pullRequest.body: https://github.com/leanprover-community/batteries/pull/851 provides a replacement in Batteries. It is not an exact replacement, so I have not given suggestion in the deprecation statements, and instead added an pointer to the new file in the module doc.

Have you tried to check if there are declarations which match closely? Assuming you have/a maintainer thinks this is not necessary: looks reasonable, thanks!
maintainer merge

I think this one is basically a drop-in replacement, semantically.
```suggestion
@[deprecated Batteries.ByteSubarray (since := "2024-08-19")]
```

```suggestion
@[deprecated "deprecated in favour of `ByteSubarray` in Batteries"  (since := "2024-08-19")]
```
Can we leave a message like this?
I don't think that makes any sense here, since `Up` is unrelated to `ByteSubarray`.
Do we not want to deprecated `upRel` as well?
I decided it wasn't necessary to individually deprecate things, once the types they talked about were deprecated... This is all unused code.
This definition doesn't talk about any deprecated types though; at least, not in it's statemenr
@digama0, is there a replacement for this elsewhere that you know of?
No. AFAIK the only reason it's being deprecated is because the semantics are somewhat weird in the non-ascii case.
Right, the semantics are pretty strange indeed; but if a `String.toAscii? : Option ByteArray` existed, it would probably be sane to mention in this message.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: deprecate Data/ByteArray
